text: Joy Udo-Gabriel (born 2 June 1999) is a Nigerian sprinter. She won a bronze medal in the 100 metres at the 2018 African Championships, a bronze medal in the 4 × 100 metres relay at the 2018 Commonwealth Games as well as a gold medal in the 4 x 100 metres relay at the 2019 African Games. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=4|2018 |rowspan=2|Commonwealth Games |rowspan=2|Gold Coast, Australia |9th (sf) |100 m |11.53 |- |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |4 × 100 m relay |42.75 |- |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Asaba, Nigeria |bgcolor=cc9966|3rd |100 m |11.58 |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |4 × 100 m relay |43.77 |- |rowspan=4|2019 |World Relays |Yokohama, Japan |17th (h) |4 × 100 m relay |45.07 |- |rowspan=2|African Games |rowspan=2|Rabat, Morocco |4th |100 m |11.44 |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |4 × 100 m relay |44.16 |- |World Championships |Doha, Qatar |10th (h) |4 × 100 m relay |43.05 |} ==Personal bests== *100 metres – 11.42 (+0.3 m/s, Gold Coast 2018) *200 metres – 24.26 (-0.8 m/s, Abuja 2017) ==References== Category:1999 births Category:Living people Category:Nigerian female sprinters Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for Nigeria Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2018 Commonwealth Games Category:Sportspeople from Abia State Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in athletics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 African Games Category:African Games competitors for Nigeria Category:African Games gold medalists for Nigeria
title: Joy Udo-Gabriel
